title: Commemorating the 300th Anniversary of St. Paul's Lutheran Church of West Camp, New York, to be celebrated on Sunday, October 17, 2010
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE RESOLUTION commemorating the 300th Anniversary of St. Paul's
Lutheran  Church  of  West  Camp,  New York, to be celebrated on Sunday,
October 17, 2010

WHEREAS, Religious institutions, and  the  many  spiritual,  social  and
educational  benefits  they confer, play a vital role in the development
of the moral fabric of a responsible citizenry; and
  WHEREAS, It is the tradition of this State  and  this  Nation  to  pay
tribute  to  those  institutions and individuals who have contributed to
the ethical and spiritual values of their communities; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body takes  pleasure  in  commemorating  the
300th  Anniversary of St. Paul's Lutheran Church of West Camp, New York,
to be celebrated on Sunday, October 17, 2010; Bishop Robert A. Rimbo  of
the  Metro  New  York Synod will be the guest preacher for the ceremony;
and
  WHEREAS, St. Paul's Lutheran Church was founded in  1710  and  is  the
oldest congregation in the Metro New York Synod / ELCA; and
  WHEREAS,  The  church  at West Camp was organized by the Palatines who
arrived in October of 1710; the first recorded  service  of  worship  at
West Camp took place on June 3, 1711; the present church was constructed
in  1871,  and the interior was renovated in 1960, its 250th anniversary
year; and
  WHEREAS, Ably led by The Reverend  Paul  C.  Walley  since  1994,  St.
Paul's  Lutheran Church stands on the threshold of tomorrow, prepared to
meet the challenges of the coming decades while retaining that spiritual
resolve which characterizes its past; and
  WHEREAS, It is the custom of this Legislative Body  to  take  note  of
enduring  religious  institutions  and to bring such institutions to the
attention of the people of this Empire State; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
commemorate  the 300th Anniversary of St. Paul's Lutheran Church of West
Camp, New York, to be observed on Sunday, October 17, 2010, fully confi-
dent that this commemoration reflects the belief in those  values  which
enhance the dignity and purpose of life; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to St. Paul's Lutheran Church, West Camp, New York.
